medical_history.chief_complaint: Left ventricular noncompaction (LVNC) diagnosed prenatally, associated with congenital heart defects.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was referred at 26 weeks of gestation due to the presence of ascites. Following birth, symptoms progressed with tachypnea and tachycardia appearing at 6 days of age, leading to surgical intervention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has severe heart failure and was diagnosed with LVNC, a hereditary cardiomyopathy.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father and grandmother had LVNC.
